description.narrative: Egypt Network for Integrated Development (ENID): The project aims to develop and design effective strategies that address obstacles to vital social and economic development challenges.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: - number of jobs created - illiteracy rate - vocational trainings

comment.narrative: - illiteracy - lack of vocational training - unemployment
- Number of beneficiaries of the vocational training - Number of jobs created - Number of beneficiaries of illiteracy classes
- 5987 beneficiaries received vocational training in which 75% are women - 4000 job opportunities in which 75% are women - 1084 beneficiaries of illiteracy classes
- Ready Made Garments (RMG) factory - Number of beneficiaries of the vocational training - Number of jobs created - Number of beneficiaries of illiteracy classes

In 2020, 1,712 beneficiaries in which around 25 % are women received training through ENID and created 590 job opportunities in which 72% are women. In addition as a response to COVID-19 ENID shifted the activity of the RMG factory in Qena to the production of medical masks to meet the high demand in Qena and created 119 jobs and training for 102 women beneficiaries on the production of masks

• Raise the capacity of 638 beneficiaries on agriculture and sewing and also train them to work in Ready Made Garments (RMG ) Factory on the production of masks. • Creation of 500 job opportunity in the area of agriculture, handicrafts, wood, furniture and production of masks. • 25 illiteracy classes which will enable them to be enrolled in the vocational training and then be qualified to secure a job. • Ready Made Garments (RMG) factory is operational, and production increased

• ENID project raised the capacity of 670 beneficiaries on agriculture and sewing and also train them to work in Ready Made Garments (RMG ) Factory on the production of masks. • ENID project created 227 job opportunity in the area in the area of agriculture, handicrafts, wood, furniture and production of masks. • 25 illiteracy classes which enable them to be enrolled in the vocational training and then be qualified to secure a job. • Production of masks factory is operational, and production increased
